metadata.title: CVE-2024-42080 on Ubuntu 24.10 (oracular) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:RDMA/restrack: Fix potential invalid address accessstruct rdma_restrack_entry's kern_name was set to KBUILD_MODNAMEin ib_create_cq(), while if the module exited but forgot del thisrdma_restrack_entry, it would cause a invalid address access inrdma_restrack_clean() when print the owner of this rdma_restrack_entry.These code is used to help find one forgotten PD release in one of theULPs. But it is not needed anymore, so delete them.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-42080` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-6.11.0-7-generic - 6.11.0-7.7
linux-image-unsigned-6.11.0-7-generic - 6.11.0-7.7
linux-image-unsigned-6.11.0-7-generic-64k - 6.11.0-7.7
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.11.0-1002-aws - 6.11.0-1002.2
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.11.0-1003-azure - 6.11.0-1003.3
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.11.0-1001-gcp - 6.11.0-1001.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.11.0-1002-lowlatency - 6.11.0-1002.2
linux-image-unsigned-6.11.0-1002-lowlatency-64k - 6.11.0-1002.2
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.11.0-1004-oracle - 6.11.0-1004.4
linux-image-unsigned-6.11.0-1004-oracle-64k - 6.11.0-1004.4
No subscription required

linux-image-6.11.0-1003-raspi - 6.11.0-1003.3
No subscription required
